description.narrative: Effective institutional, legislative and policy frameworks in place to enhance the implementation of disaster and climate risk management measures at national and sub-national levels

The First Biennial Update Report (FBUR) and Fourth National Communication (4NC) of the Republic of Tajikistan under the UNFCCC Convention in accordance with its commitments as a non-Annex 1 Party (as mandated by Article 4 and 12 of this Convention) and COP 17 decisions, are prepared and submitted.

comment.narrative: The Third National Communication (3NC) of the Republic of Tajikistan under the UNFCCC Convention has been prepared and submitted to the UNFCCC in accordance with its commitments as a non-Annex 1 Party (as mandated by Article 4 and 12 of this Convention) and COP 17 decisions. The system of GHG reporting in Tajikistan is non-existent.

1. Timely completion of project activities and achievement of the expected results of the project in various directions by observing the deadlines for completing each section of the project, ensuring the implementation of activities in accordance with the Project Document. Preparation of the final version of the Fourth National Communication. 2. Preparation and submission of the necessary documents to the Government for the implementation of the national Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (MRV) system. 3. Forecasting greenhouse gas emissions in key sectors and assessing the impact of climate change policies and measures. To conduct training for local experts on the basics of forecasting emissions.

1. During the 2020, due to the pandemic COVID-19, project activity decreased and there was a risk of not completion of the project up to the end date. In this regard the project was extended up to 12 June 2021. Nevertheless, most of the work including key objectives and results were carried out. Collected and analyzed data on climatic conditions and socio-economic characteristics of the country over the past 10 years, related to the problems of climate change. Particular attention is paid to data on sectors of the economy that are considered sources of greenhouse gas emissions. In addition, information was provided on health care, as well as on the latest developments regarding the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on the country's economy. Data collection was carried out and the volumes of GHG emissions in key sectors of the economy for 2004-2016 were estimated. In addition, calculations of GHG emissions by precursors for all sectors for 2004–2016 were performed. Information was prepared on key sources of GHG emissions, by types of gases and emissions of precursors. The final report on the inventory of GHG emissions for 2004-2016 has been prepared, which will be included in the 4NC. according to the results of observations due to the increase in air temperature in the Zeravshan river basin for 1940-2020. by 0.11оС / 10 years and 3.1-3.4оС by 2050, as well as an increase in atmospheric precipitation by 2050 by 21-24%, the volume of runoff will increase from 29% to 39%. According to forecast data, by 2050 the glaciated area in the Zeravshan river basin will decrease to 50%. An increase in temperature in the Vakhsh river basin by 2050 is expected by 0.4 - 0.7 ° C, an increase in the amount of atmospheric precipitation by 2050 will be 7-9%. By 2050, the decrease in the flow of the Vakhsh River will be 7%. In the Pyanj river basin, by 2050, the temperature is expected to increase by 0.31-0.54 ° C and the increase in precipitation by 0.9%. It is expected that the Gunt River runoff will decrease by 3-4% by 2050 and the Vanj River runoff will increase by 5-7% by 2050. The volume of glaciers in the basins of the Vakhsh and Pyanj rivers will decrease by 55-56% and 79-80%, respectively, by 2050, while the glaciated areas will decrease by 48% and 73%, respectively. 2. MRV consultants consulted on Skype with members of the Working Group, including representatives of the Ministry of Energy and Water Resources, Industry and New Technologies, Agriculture, Transport, the Statistics Agency, the Forestry Agency, the Agency for Land Reclamation and Irrigation, State Unitary Enterprise “Zhilishno-Kommunalnoe economy ”and the Academy of Sciences. During the consultations, the sides discussed issues of relations between the above ministries and departments on the creation of the MRV system. Based on the roles and responsibilities of each ministry and organization, developing a national MRV system for inventorying greenhouse gas emissions will provide government officials, investors and other stakeholders with up-to-date and reliable information. The consultants have developed a draft Program on the national MRV system, which will be submitted to the Committee on Environmental Protection after revising the corrections. 3. The forecast of greenhouse gas emissions in Tajikistan until 2030 has been completed. A tool for forecasting has been developed. The tool estimates three different scenarios or emission pathways. The three different scenarios that have been estimated in the tool are the Without Measures (WoM) scenario, the With Existing Measures (WeM) scenario, and the With Additional Measures (WaM) scenario. A manual has been developed for independent mastering of the forecasting tool. This manual describes how to use the tool for estimating the greenhouse gas (GHG) emission projections of Tajikistan until 2030. This manual has been produced alongside a set of recorded tutorials to provide a better understanding of how to perform the estimations and how to use the tool. The recorded tutorials are mentioned in this manual when needed, to show examples or to deal with more complex issues.

1. Data collection and information using official statistics and interdepartmental documentation. Complete and update the available materials until 2018 on national conditions. 2. Preparation FBUR for 2018 and submit to UNFCCC. Calculation of GHG emissions for 2015-2016 and improving the reliability of the results of GHG emissions. 3. Based on the vulnerability assessment and adaptation, the calculation of the possible costs of long-term adaptation for the industrial, agriculture and water sector under the normal development scenario. 4. Preparation of detailed comprehensive recommendations for creating, developing and maintaining a national MRV system. 5. Based on the mitigation assessment, the calculation of the financial resources required to implement the strategy to reduce greenhouse gas emissions 6. Conducting a study to assess technology needs, as well as drawing up a list of the most effective technological solutions for the energy and the agricultural sector.

1. Data collection was carried out using official statistical materials and interdepartmental documentation. Existing data for the national conditions has been added and updated up to 2018. The relationships between national development strategies, sectoral and climate change policies were analyzed, which were updated on the basis of socio-economic indicators until 2018. 2. The first biennial report (FBUR) on the inventory of greenhouse gases was approved by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan and submitted on the website of the UN Framework Convention (https://unfccc.int/BURs) on July 18, 2019. Greenhouse gas emissions for 2015 and 2016 were calculated on the basis of statistical data for sectors energy, industry, agriculture, forestry and land use, waste. 3. In the context of the effects of climate change, an assessment was made of the impacts on the land use and forestry sectors, as well as on human health and the environment. Based on the impact and adaptation assessment, a cost-benefit analysis was carried out to calculate the potential costs of long-term adaptation in the agricultural sector under the normal development scenario. 4. A letter was sent to the Government to create a working group, which should regularly collect the necessary information, register greenhouse gases and implement an internal monitoring, reporting and verification (MRV) system. All key ministries introduced their representatives to create a working group. A seminar was held with the participation of members of the working group from key ministries on August 26, 2019 at the Atlas Hotel (32-34 Nisor Muhammad) on the topic “Assessing Tajikistan’s Readiness to Implement the MRV System”. On the seminar was discussed the data collection process for analyzing climate change in key sectors and the specifics of implementing the MRV system. 5. Based on the climate change mitigation assessment, the necessary financial resources were compiled to implement the strategy for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and a list of necessary measures was prepared. 6. A study was conducted to assess technological requirements, as well as to compile a list of the most technologically advanced requirements for the energy and agricultural sectors.

1. Features of the country, its population, natural resources, climate and economy, which may affect the country's ability to deal with climate change mitigation and adaptation described. National development objectives, priorities and circumstances impacted by climate risks described and mainstreaming progress into policy frameworks assessed. 2. Completed Chapter on National GHG Inventory for FBUR and FNС, period 2004-2014 3. In-depth vulnerability assessment of key socio-economic sectors (energy, agriculture, transport) and natural environment to climate impacts conducted. A study integrating response measures in the context of Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Change Adaptation (CCA) conducted. 4. Completed Chapter on Mitigation and Policy Measures for the Fourth National Communication on Climate Change. 5. Completed Chapter on domestic MRV for the Fourth National Communication on Climate Change. 6. Completed a part of Chapter on constraints and gaps, finance, technology and capacity needs. 7. Conducting training on climate change negotiations for young professionals engaged in climate change. Conducting a study on different gender roles in adaptation and mitigation interventions at the community level, policy formulation and decision-making process. Summarizing the chapter on other information, relevant for 4NC and FBUR.

1. In close collaboration with national experts were prepared report of 38-pages on National conditions, which will be analyzed and used for the first chapter of the Biennial report on national conditions. 2. The National Consultant and the group of experts was recalculated and compared the results of the previous inventory for 2004-2010 and evaluated the GHG inventory for 2011-2014. All calculations are completed and the main chapter on the GHG emission inventory is prepared for the Biennial report. The Biennial report is prepared on Russian on volume 115 pages. 3. In-depth vulnerability assessment in water and energy sector, public health, environment, agriculture, land use and forestry to climate impacts is completed. The impact of climate change on natural disasters in Tajikistan and the human impact on emergencies in terms of climate change was investigated. Conducted the analysis of regulatory documents, programs and strategies related to the issues of reducing the risks of natural emergencies, review and analysis of studies on emergency situations related to climate change. The analysis of the dynamics of the spread of the most dangerous natural phenomena and damage assessment has been carried out. The most vulnerable populations to disasters are shown. The ranking methodology is given in the most vulnerable areas in terms of risks, impacts and adaptation potential of climate change, identifying the most vulnerable areas to the risk of climate change at the level of regions and jamoats is given. 4. In the chapter on climate change mitigation, policies and measures for key sectors, lists of all implemented and planned measures to reduce GHG emissions, at the national and regional levels, were compiled. These results in this area were included in a separate chapter on GHG mitigation for the Biennial Report. 5. In Chapter on domestic MRV for the Fourth National Communication was reviewed two possibilities of implementation of MRV system in Tajikistan: a) on base of Environmental Committee and b) on base of Statistical Agency. The advantages and disadvantages of each of these two options are considered. This idea and work will be continuing in 2019. 6. А part of Chapter on constraints and gaps, finance, technology and capacity needs in water sector, public health, environment, land use and forestry is completed. 7. In order to improve of capacity building the International Consultant on GHG inventory and MRV at the Agency for Hydrometeorology, held three workshops for young professionals involved in climate change. A review and analysis of studies were conducted on issues related to the impact of climate change on women and the most vulnerable segments of the population has been carried out. The gender aspects of access to basic livelihoods, taking into account the objectives of the Sustainable Development Goals and Climate Change, access to the education system, the health system, gender aspects of land use and land management, gender aspects of access to energy resources, gender aspects of natural disasters and their management, gender aspects of access to water and water resources management, gender aspects of access to financial resources. Also considered such important issues as women's participation in pasture management and forestry, and activities related to increasing community resilience to climate change from a gender perspective.
